contentrichtext.text: {{distinguish|Eirug Wyn}} {{Infobox MP | name= Eurig Wyn |honorific-suffix = | birth_date = 1944 | birth_place = | office = [[Member of European Parliament]] <br> for [[Wales (European Parliament constituency)|Wales]] | term_start = 10 June 1999 | term_end = 10 June 2004 | predecessor = ''Constituency created'' | successor = ''Constituency abolished'' | party = [[Plaid Cymru]] | website = | profession = | spouse = | children = }} '''Eurig Wyn''' (born 1944) is a [[Wales|Welsh]] [[Politics of Wales|politician]]. He was a [[Plaid Cymru]] [[Member of the European Parliament]] for [[Wales]] from 1999 to 2004, when he lost his seat in part due to a reduction of the number of seats that [[Wales]] had. He had previously been a journalist for the [[BBC]]. During 2005, Eurig Wyn was selected as [[Plaid Cymru]]'s parliamentary candidate for the [[Ynys Môn (UK Parliament constituency)|Ynys Môn constituency]]. Prior to his selection, Eurig Wyn had spent about a year building up a profile in [[Ynys Môn (UK Parliament constituency)|Ynys Môn]] with a view to eventually taking the seat back from the [[Labour Party (UK)]], following Plaid Cymru's loss in 2001. The seat was the party's key target seat in the [[United Kingdom general election, 2005|2005 General Election]]; however, Plaid had their proportion of the vote reduced and the [[Labour Party (UK)|Labour Party]] held on to it, all main parties saw their vote fall due to independent candidate, [[Peter Rogers (politician)|Peter Rogers]], who came 3rd and took a large share of the vote. ==See also== *[[Jillian Evans]] MEP (Plaid Cymru) ==External links== *[http://www.europarl.europa.eu/members/archive/alphaOrder/view.do;jsessionid=7CF6B373153376D74AC83913DAECBFC4.node2?language=EN&id=4551 Profile at European Parliament website] {{start box}} {{s-par|eu}} {{succession box | title = [[Member of European Parliament]] for [[Wales (European Parliament constituency)|Wales]] | years = [[European Parliament election, 1999 (UK)|1999]]–[[European Parliament election, 2004 (UK)|2004]] | before = Constituency created | after = Number of representatives reduced }} {{end box}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Wyn, Eurig | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = welsh MEP | DATE OF BIRTH = 1944 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Wyn, Eurig}} [[Category:1944 births]] [[Category:Plaid Cymru politicians]] [[Category:Welsh journalists]] [[Category:Welsh politicians]] [[Category:Welsh-speaking people]] [[Category:Members of the European Parliament for Welsh constituencies]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Plaid Cymru MEPs]] [[Category:MEPs for the United Kingdom 1999–2004]]
